text.full:
This is the first time I have ever tried Afghanistan cuisine and it was mind blowing. The blend of spices, textures, and flavors created a unique and satisfying dining experience that left me craving more. The service was amazing and the staff were extremely knowledgeable about the menu and eager to share information about the cultural origins of each dish.

for starter we had their seasonal off the menu Brussel sprouts, egg plant dip and Bolani. The Brussel sprouts were cooked to perfection, with a crispy exterior and a tender, flavorful interior. I would rate it (3.5/5).

Egg plant dip (4/5) amazing. Packed with flavor and goes really well with their flatbread.

Bolani (5/5) is a traditional Afghanistan street food. The way the restaurant prepared it was truly exceptional.

For the main course we had Slow Cooked Lamb Shoulder & Seven Spice Roast Half Chicken & Uzbeki Palaw. The lamb was so tender that it fell off the bone with just a fork, and the spices had permeated the meat, creating a depth of flavor that was simply incredible. When you pair it with Uzbeki Palaw it was heaven! The combination was just perfection. (5/5) The Roast Chicken also (5/5) it was cooked to perfection. It was so moist and packed with flavor that you cant stop wanting to have the next bite.

I have been raving about this restaurant to my family and friends and I would definitely come back again! because the amount of care they put towards their food I understand why when you make a reservation they ask for $50 deposit per person in case you don't show up.

The best lamb ever!!!
The staff was so informative and attentive, and described each dish we ordered- how it was prepared, what each component was, etc.
The dumplings were a standout for me, and my dad said the lamb shoulder was the best he ever had.
There are also some really fun cocktails to order.

PS don't leave without ordering the tres leches!

Ah, what a wonderful meal. Was very easy to make a reservation online ahead of time. Service was prompt and attentive. 
- Bamyan ($10) - amazing mocktail. Loved the mango melona popsicle. Really tasted like a mango lassi. 
- Pakawra ($19) - loved how crispy this was. Chutney was so refreshing and flavourful. 
- Oyster mushroom kebab ($23) - wow so flavourful for a gluten free dish. Mushrooms were amazing on its own with a beautiful char. 
- Lamb shoulder ($46) - delicious and fell off the bone. I personally loved the eggplant and pickled cabbage. The pickled eggplant and cauliflower was a little too sour for my taste. 
- Uzbeki palaw ($26) - it was just okay. Felt like we needed a carb with the lamb shoulder and this was recommended to us. Lamb felt overcooked and the rice wasn't as flavourful as I expected. Would get the challow or naan next time. 
- Milk pudding ($9) - loved the texture and cardamom spice in this. Very shareable as it's quite filling.

One of my fave places to go! A perfect place to go in big groups as the food is meant to be shared (+ who doesn't love being able to try more dishes?) As good as the food is, I must also give kudos for their drinks. They have a really unique list of drinks (alcoholic and non-alcoholic). Additionally, they switch up the menu every so often so there's a good chance you'll be trying new things. 

The service is so good. Everyone is so nice and hospitable. The staff are warm and welcoming and they really know their stuff! When I come here in big groups, I often look to the staff for portion recommendations and pairings. 

The ambiance of the place is amazing. The place has a lot of windows so the natural light influences the vibe of the place. In the winter time, it's a bit darker and more intimate. In the summer, sunshine comes through and it's light and bright (a more airy sense of space). 

Highly recommend a reservation in advance (as much as possible) as this place is ALWAYS busy. It'll be hard to get a walk in for dinner time. I've never gone without a reservation.
Amazing food and wonderful service. Beautiful cafe with delicious food. I love getting a good breakfast and/or brunch, and this spot definitely is the place for that.

Decided to sit out on the patio for brunch. It was a good option since the patio is shaded and it wasn't too hot outside. Although the traffic can be quite loud since it faces main street. 

I ordered the mango matcha. At $10 it was definitely a treat, but I had been craving a good matcha for a long time. I will say the size of the drink was quite large and there were a decent amount of mango chunks. I think for a drink like this, I would have preferred a mix of mango puree and chunks. It was hard to drink with the straw since it was a paper straw and it became limp before I could finish the drink. Understandable they're trying to be eco friendly. I ended up just drinking the rest without a straw. 

As for the food, I had the kebab and egg skillet. The portion was quite large. It had large chunks of beef, plenty of potatoes, two poached eggs and bread. Flavours were on point. The beef was a tad dry but with the spiced yogurt it was good. Service was attentive and friendly. Overall it was a solid brunch meal.

Busy brunch place and great location! I little crowded on a weekend and seats are tight but really cool menu for brunch's I had the fruit concoction with rum I think and it was strong! lol I loved the fruit loops. The chicken waffles was delicious! My son had eggs benny with pulled pork and it looked delicious. The staff was attentive and service quick. We'll be back!

businessPhotos.caption: Chicken waffle and pulled pork eggs Benny

text.full: This is one of the must stop restaurants when I have family or friends in town and one of the places happy to be on repeat. We started with A Camel Named Gerald and Dr Damji's Negroni cocktails as celebrating milestone birthdays. I am not a Negroni fan but my friend is and the presentation of the Negroni was great with the infused smoke. My cocktail had my favs mezcal, tequila, rosewater and hazelnut in a delicious concoction, tad on the sweeter side but based on the ingredients, my endless love for mezcal was worth a $20 cocktail. We started with the beets & burrata salad which was pretty good, nice start to our early dinner before our musical at the Stanley. Then we had coconut fish dumplings in a tumeric base which were very good and my favorite of the evening but we never got a clear response from our waitress on what was the white fish as she said she would check and let us know and never did, as she thought it was cod but another waiter that brought our next course said it was halibut. Unfortunately our last course was a disappointment as our waitress recommended the lamb shoulder but it was our least favorite of the evening and wish I had ordered the leg of lamb again as I described how it falls off the bone but the lamb shoulder was overcooked and tougher to enjoy. Would be keen to try them for happy hour as hoping it is better for value while they still have it during the week as their prices have gone up substantially.

Came here for dinner on a weekday. Got late reservations at the bar. Reservations are a must. 

Service was fabulous. Server and bartender both super friendly and helpful with the menu. 

We were recommended 3 dishes among 2 ppl to share. This was the perfect amount. 

We ordered:
The vegetarian "meatballs". Spicy and tasty but a little too salty for us. 
Beef mantu dumplings- comes with 4 pcs and they're big. These were excellent. 
Lamb shank. Server recommended the rice side with it so we got it too. Excellent combo, easy recommend. 

Dessert: we shared a milk pudding. Also delicious but somewhat heavy. Think panna cotta but thicker and heavier. 

We finished all this food between 2 of us and were super stuffed. 

Restaurant is on the small side but nice decor. Bar stools not super comfortable but fine. Ambience is pretty chill. Not too noisy. They have a small outdoor patio too. 

We shared the medjool date non-alcoholic "cocktail" which was interesting. They have a sizeable cocktail menu but it's quite pricey. 

Metered parking on the street and there's a pay lot behind the building. 

Despite my minor gripes, this is a 5/5 for me. Good food, service, nice venue, would come back for sure.

There's nothing I love more than exploring the world of fusion food, and this Afghan-inspired brunch was a delightful adventure! I ordered the "Full Afghan," a creative twist on the classic full English breakfast, and was blown away by the variety of flavors and textures. Every bite was a journey, and I can't wait to go back for more!
Service was amazing, and the tomato braised lamb dish was one of the best I've had! The decor was modern and lovely

Zarak provides fusion Afghan cuisines. They had separate lunch and dinner menu but we specifically came to try their weekend brunch menu. Amazing service (the owner greeted each table and check in periodically despite how busy the place was) with great warm and airy ambiance. Brunch was overall tasty and I would come back to try more dishes.

Full Afghan ($29) plus chutney ($3) 7.5/10
Zarak's take on full english breakfast menu with lamb sausage, fried eggs, kidney bean curry, eggplant, and potato bread. Honestly I'm not a fan of sausage in general, so the lamb sausage was a bit lacklustre and gamey for me. The bean curry and eggplant were the highlight, especially eaten with the potato bread and chutney.

Kebab & Eggs Skillet ($25) 7.5/10
Juicy beef with medium poached eggs. Potato was nicely crispy and the spiced yoghurt was strangely addicting. They also gave you two flatbreads, which we barely touched because how big the portions were.

Karak Chai ($6) & Iced Latte ($6)
One thing I need to highlight about Zarak is that they have a variety of unique seasonal drinks. We got pretty basic coffee and chai (though the biscuit was quite tasty) but nowadays they have anything from strawberry matcha to pistachio latte.

This place is the absolute BEST!! We are from Vegas and have one of the top restaurants and are used to great food and beautiful ambiance but Zarak restaurant was everything we expected. Delicious food, clean and organized. The service was incredible. If you're in Vancouver and you want something authentic and delicious then Zarak is the spot. We'll definitely be back!

We FEASTED @zarakvancouver! 

Their menu isn't massive; however, everything they have is excellent! We started off with their buttermilk fried chicken which was exquisite! The blends of different spices and love how juicy they were. The spring rolls were a great with a crispy shell filled with minced beef and cabbage. Their mantu dumplings were soooo good that we could have ordered more...

Butter cauliflower curry, chicken thigh kebab, seven spice half roast chicken, lamb shoulder, volcano, and Uzbeki palaw... we didn't leave any room at all for dessert. 

You can't go wrong with any of their dishes so make sure you go with a group of family or friends to sample them all!

Food is amazing but for some reason we both had stomach issues... not sure but we really enjoyed it while eating it. I will definitely give it another try during brunch time because even the atmosphere is divine.
Value 3/5
Atmosphere 5/5
Service 4/5
Quality 4/5
16/20
Amazing experience.  If you are in the neighborhood this is a must try spot. Food is flavorful and perfectly executed.  Service is attentive and personalized.

From the start to the end we enjoyed our anniversary at Zarak. We love the ambiance in there. Seating is nice, the decor is tasteful. Everything was perfect to be honest. The timing of food coming out from appetizers to entrees to dessert was within a good timeframe. We waited a few mins but not so long that we would be hungry. We were satiated between dishes. Needless to say we left with our bellies full, craving for more. I know! We are already planning our next meal there. Every single dish was full of flavour that it made me smile with every bite. You can't go wrong with any of their menu items. Just ask your server they can recommend choices that are to your taste palate. However, I will say the fish dumplings in the coconut tumeric broth was so good that I used the naan to sop up the broth. Their beets & burrata salad is massive, definitely one to share. It has a bit of spice kick to it but is cooled down by the burrata, beets & sweetness of the cranberries & pickled mulberries. We had the chicken kebab which was full of flavor and very tender, It was a nice dish to end it. But of course no dinner is complete without trying the desserts! We got the Shir Yakh which was a rosewater & cardamom gelato with crumbled pistachio in a creamy sauce, kind of like a lighter version of condense milk. It was pretty in pink & did not taste heavy or too sweet but enough to fulfill your dessert craving. We had a bit of a hiccup during our dinner but Gary (manager) dealt with the problem quickly and professionally. We didn't expect much as we were already happy with everything but Gary and Sanmeet still went above and beyond. We felt like regulars there even though it was our first time, but that's how their staff makes you feel...like family/friends. Highly recommend you go here for their dinner and brunch. Both experiences will leave you craving for more & will not disappoint!

businessPhotos.caption: Beets and Burrata + Pakawra with mint yogurt chutney sauce
Avocado toast with 2 poached eggs pickled onions & pea sprouts on top
Eggplant Benny w/Potato Fritter & seasonal greens
Fish dumpling in coconut tumeric broth

text.full: I have had both brunch and dinner at Zarak. Breakfast was wonderful. Their chai was so good I had two cups. Dinner was good, albeit overwhelmingly garlicky (and I love garlic).

This is a lovely restaurant with friendly and personable wait staff. The ambience is lovely and bustling but very homey (as the staff shared that the restaurant was started by a mother). They have excellent showmanship, so if you're looking to impressive some guests, this is a great choice. Taste wise, not everything is outstanding but easily satisfactory. We particularly enjoyed the chilled eggplant and Brussel sprouts.

Zarak never disappoints! This was my second visit and all the food was so delicious. The lavender cocktail was so delicious. The Mantu was well seasoned and had a great balance of flavour. The lamb shank was perfectly cooked and everything on the plate balanced out the meal wonderfully. The bolani was crispy and delicious. The rose and cardamom ice cream was the perfect end to the meal, light and creamy. Our server, Fazl was so incredibly kind and talked us through the whole meal. Definitely some of the best service I've received. He made sure all our questions were answered, all our food was up to standard, and gave us personalized recommendations!! Can't wait to come back.

Absolutely delicious - and, be warned! - large quantities, haha. I wasn't even going to eat the brussels sprouts my family ordered, but they were SO good!  And don't miss the fried chicken appetizer.
Our server, Alvah (sp?) was just marvelous and went way out of her way to check on the contents of dishes to avoid an allergy issue, as well as just being a ray of sunshine every time she came by the table.
Delightful.
I should add that although we spent $60-70 per person, we ordered way too much.  Everything on the menu looked so good - and it was - but the portions were so generous that we had to take about half of it home.

This was a beautiful location for brunch. Great views of the city, good food and very hospitable service. The servers took great care to make sure we got the right items. The food was good but comparable to other brunch spots. However, the ceaser flight is a must try. The other drinks looked spectacular as well.

weekend brunch in vancouver with friends is always a treat.  we made resos through open table, though, i am not a fan of providing my credit card for resos, their $50 charge/person for no shows, but i understand why they do this.  

located on the corner of main and east fifth in mount pleasant, there's ample street parking available.  

the staff were genuinely friendly, asked if this was our first time here, gave us time to look over the menu and asked if we had any questions, and/or food allergies.  one of our friends ordered a chai, and she was expecting a carafe big enough to share, our server apologized, and promptly took the hot chai and replaced it with an iced dirty chai, still no carafe though, chalk this up as a miscommunication snafu.  another server approached us at the end of our meal and asked how we were doing, shared info about their most popular dishes, dumplings and lamb.  he mentioned that the owner's mom is a cook at this restaurant.  no, zarak is not affiliated with the afghan horseman, but they are linked with the afghan kitchen in surrey, and opened up to us that there's a new restaurant, in the works, right next door, which will be more upscale.

the venue has a fresh, modern, and trendy vibe, with a light and vibrant atmosphere enhanced by beautiful artwork.

i don't know anything about afghan food and it was recommended that i try their full afghan with lamb sausage, fried eggs, kidney bean curry, eggplant, and potato flatbread.  it was delicious, hearty and had a gentle warmth from the spices.

the drink menu was tempting, featuring flights of mimosa and caesar, but I chose the iced strawberry latte with fresh strawberries, cold brew, and oat milk.  

weekend brunch at zarak offered a delightful experience with good food, a welcoming atmosphere, and hospitable service, i would highly recommend.

businessPhotos.caption: chicken + waffle, seven spice buttermilk, mango chilli aioli
lots of natural light streaming into the restaurant
full afghan, lamb sausage, fried eggs, kidney beans curry, eggplant, potato
trendy brunch spot in the mount pleasant neighboruhood
benny flight, spiced hashbrowns, and a waffle, seasonal fruit compote, cardamom maple syrup
weekend treat, brunch at zarak with friends
iced dirty masala chai, cold brew, oat milk and iced strawberry latte

text.full:
Come here for great service, food, and vibes!

I really enjoyed dining at Zarak. The food is packed with flavour, and the drinks are so creative. I tried a few of the popular items here: brussel sprouts, lamb shank, mantu, and spicy chicken - they are well-loved, and for good reason! I also ordered the Band-e-Amir, a beautiful purple cocktail that was equally pretty as it was delicious.
The food was a bit spicy (especially the chicken), but it was done well, and without covering up/sacrificing flavour. Both the lamb shank and chicken were cooked until tender. Perfection! My favourite dish was the brussel sprouts.. I don't know what they did to make it so delicious, but it's a must order in my books.
Great food and customer service. We came here to celebrate my dad's birthday. He has never had Afghan cuisine and absolutely loved it. Highly recommend this place.

Went to Zarak tonight for our wedding anniversary. Wanted to try this place a long time and it definitely delivered!! We got there right as it opened and got a table. Within 20 minutes the place was full! Make a reservation if you can. 
Everything was amazing. The place is small but bright modern and clean. 
The waitress was so helpful, sweet, and knowledgeable about all the dishes. 
Service was quick and the food was all so flavourful and delicious!! Can't wait to come back and try more of the menu!

Dinner at Zarak. Bustling with people for a week night.
We had 
leek dumplings
tomato braised lamb shank 
fish Masala curry



Food connects us all.

We dined at Zara'k last night while visiting Vancouver. what a great experience, love the dishes, full of flavors and presented very well . This is neighborhood gem

Excellent service , very friendly and they explained the dishes ( for first timers like us) Jerri took good care of us, warm smiles and very knowledgeable of the menu and dishes 

Must try in Mount Pleasant
Nice atmosphere. Service was good. Eggs Benedict with lamb was good, but I didn't like that half the plate was taken up with tater tots. Would be better with another side to compliment

businessPhotos.caption: Eggs Benedict with lamb, chicken & waffles

text.full: My sons introduced me to this wonderful establishment today and i full enjoyed the experience. Service was truly exceptional.  The food was indeed authentic and prepared by a very talented chef. I highly recommend.
